title: nursing admission
description: A 45-year-old male with a history of heart disease and one pack a day smoking habit x 30 years. A wound has developed to the right inner calf measuring 3cm x 3cm x 1cm. The wound base is pale, with yellow slough present; wound edges are round, peri-wound skin is very dry, and no exudate is present. There is no undermining or tunneling. The client complains of pain at night when lying down.
